Sending emails

Sooner or later you realize that you need to communicate with users. Maybe you want to send them a newsletter or welcome them with a transactional email.

When you sign up to MailChimp using someone's referral link, both of you will receive $30 in MailChimp's credits that can be used when you become a paying customer.

Simply click the "Open MailChimp" button and register to receive your credits.

  • Email campaigns
  • Transactional emails

MailChimp

  • Free plan
  • 10,00 emails per month
  • 2,000 subscribers
  • Free automation emails
  • Transactional emails (API)
    available with Mandrill (paid)
  • "Pay per use" option available
  • Open MailChimp

SendinBlue

  • Free plan
  • 300 emails per day
    (and a "Requeue" feature)
  • Unlimited subscribers
  • Free automation emails
  • Free transactional emails
  • No "Pay per use"
  • Transactional SMS (paid)
  • Open SendinBlue

Amazon SES

  • Sending emails from an application
    hosted on EC2: 62,000 free emails
    per month (otherwise, you pay
    $0.10 per 1,000 emails)
  • Attachments: $0.12/GB
  • Fees for receiving emails
    (first 1,000 are free)
  • Open Amazon SES

Mailgun

  • 10,000 free emails per month
  • 100 free validations per month
  • Free incoming emails
  • 5 days of log retention for free
  • Monthly plans or pay as you go
  • Attachments up to 25MB (free)
  • Open Mailgun

Affiliate links

Affiliate links have a special code in the URL. If you register from this link, some companies will give free credits to either both of us or just to me (depending on how a company set up their affiliation program - I always ask if they have some coupon codes that will give credits to both sides). Those credits can be used on their website (for a few months of free hosting, a cheaper domain, etc.) or redeemed for money (only for domains providers).

Affiliation program doesn't affect whether a company is recommended or not. You can read more about how I select companies/tools on the About & contact page.
